DataElement.preferredName: Exploratory Research Cohort Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation in an exploratory cohort study as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exploratory Research Cohort Study Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory._A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke)._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory.:A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory.

A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is enrolled in the
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the exploratory cohort, does patient have extrapulmonary small cell cancers (cancers with small cell morphology and arising outside the lung, such as small cell prostate, bladder, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the non-thoracic, non-BRD4 exploratory cohort, patient lacks BRD4-NUT rearrangement as identified via FISH testing performed at the BWH CAMD?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the non-thoracic, non-BRD4NUT exploratory cohort, does patient have a diagnosis of NC as defined in Section 3.1.1.1, but lacks BRD4-NUT rearrangement?
